aifield package

Submodules

aifield.board module

class aifield.board.Board(size_of_board, mine_probability)[source]

Bases: object

A class to represent a game board with mines and bombs, which also assigns features from the Iris dataset.

size_of_board

The size of the board (size x size).

Type:

int

mine_probability

The probability of a cell containing a mine or bomb.

Type:

float

array

The generated board array with mines and bombs.

Type:

np.ndarray

amount_of_mines

The total number of mines on the board.

Type:

int

amount_of_bombs

The total number of bombs on the board.

Type:

int

assigned_test_features

The features from the Iris dataset assigned to the board cells.

Type:

np.ndarray

Note

The Iris dataset from scikit-learn is used to assign features to the board cells. More information about the Iris dataset can be found at: https://scikit-learn.org/stable/auto_examples/datasets/plot_iris_dataset.html

aifield.classifier_general module

class aifield.classifier_general.ClassifierGeneral(classifier_name, random_state)[source]

Bases: object

A general classifier wrapper class that allows the selection and use of various machine learning classifiers from scikit-learn.

classifier_name

The name of the classifier to use.

Type:

str

random_state

The random state for reproducibility.

Type:

int

classifier

The selected classifier instance.

Type:

object

Note

For more information about the classifiers, refer to the scikit-learn documentation: https://scikit-learn.org/stable/supervised_learning.html

train()[source]

Trains the classifier using the augmented Iris dataset loaded from CSV.

predict(features)[source]

Predicts the class label for a given set of features.

Parameters:

features (array-like) – The input features for prediction.

Returns:

The predicted class label.

Return type:

int

aifield.gui module

aifield.simulation module

class aifield.simulation.Simulation(size_of_board, mine_probability, classifier_name, type_of_path=None, amount_of_soldiers=100)[source]

Bases: object

A class to simulate the movement and actions of soldiers on a board with mines and bombs.

board

The game board with mines and bombs.

Type:

Board

type_of_path

The type of path soldiers take (‘Horizontal’ or ‘Diagonal’).

Type:

str

_classifier

The classifier used to predict the presence of mines and bombs.

Type:

ClassifierGeneral

amount_of_soldiers

The initial number of soldiers.

Type:

int

survivors

The current number of surviving soldiers.

Type:

int

_special_soldiers

A list of special soldiers (Heavy and Sapper).

Type:

list

_good_predictions

The number of correct predictions made by the classifier.

Type:

int

disarmed_mines

The number of mines disarmed.

Type:

int

disarmed_bombs

The number of bombs disarmed.

Type:

int

random_events_log

A log of random events that occurred during the simulation.

Type:

list

accuracy

The accuracy of the classifier’s predictions.

Type:

float

found_kits

The number of disarming kits found during the simulation.

Type:

int

disarmed_locations

The set of locations where mines and bombs were disarmed.

Type:

set

simulate()[source]

Runs the simulation and logs the results.

aifield.soldier module

class aifield.soldier.Soldier(health=100)[source]

Bases: ABC

An abstract base class representing a generic soldier with health.

health

The health of the soldier.

Type:

int

abstract react_to_mine()[source]

Defines the reaction to a mine. Must be implemented by subclasses.

abstract react_to_bomb()[source]

Defines the reaction to a bomb. Must be implemented by subclasses.

class aifield.soldier.Heavy(health)[source]

Bases: Soldier

A class representing a heavy soldier with additional armor.

health

The health of the soldier.

Type:

int

armor

The armor of the soldier.

Type:

int

react_to_mine()[source]

Reacts to a mine by reducing armor if sufficient, otherwise reduces health.

Overrides:

Soldier.react_to_mine

react_to_bomb()[source]

Reacts to a bomb by significantly reducing armor or health.

Overrides:

Soldier.react_to_mine

react_to_enemy()[source]

Reacts to an enemy by setting health and armor to 0.

class aifield.soldier.Sapper(health, disarming_kits)[source]

Bases: Soldier

A class representing a sapper soldier with disarming kits.

health

The health of the soldier.

Type:

int

disarming_kits

The number of disarming kits the soldier has.

Type:

int

react_to_mine()[source]

Reacts to a mine by using a disarming kit if available, otherwise reduces health to 0.

Overrides:

Soldier.react_to_mine

react_to_bomb()[source]

Reacts to a bomb by using two disarming kits if available, otherwise reduces health to 0.

Overrides:

Soldier.react_to_mine

add_kit()[source]

Adds a random number of disarming kits (1 or 2) to the sapper’s inventory.

aifield.troops module

class aifield.troops.Troops[source]

Bases: object

A class to create and manage a collection of soldiers, including Heavy and Sapper types.

Static Methods:

create_soldiers(quantity): Creates a specified quantity of soldiers with a fixed percentage of Heavy and Sapper types.

static create_soldiers(quantity)[source]

Creates a specified quantity of soldiers, including a fixed percentage of Heavy and Sapper types.

Parameters:

quantity (int) – The total number of soldiers to create.

Returns:

A list of soldier instances, shuffled to mix Heavy and Sapper soldiers.

Return type:

list

Note

The distribution of soldiers is as follows: - 3% Heavy soldiers - 2% Sapper soldiers
